contextId.information: These words are the beginning of Jesus' comparison. Jesus is saying that the people were like children who were never satisfied with the way other children acted. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

Wolves attack and kill sheep. This metaphor therefore means that there are people who would attempt to harm the disciples that Jesus is sending out. The names of other animals could be substituted. AT: "when I send you out, people will want to harm you as wolves attack sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: I send you out as lambs in the midst of wolves

contextId.information: The comparison can be clearly stated as a simile. AT: "When someone listens to you, it is as if they are listening to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: The one who listens to you listens to me

contextId.information: The comparison can be clearly stated as a simile. AT: "when someone rejects me, it is as if they are rejecting the one who sent me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: the one who rejects me rejects the one who sent me

contextId.information: Jesus used a simile to compare how God was defeating Satan when his 70 disciples were preaching in the towns to the way lightning strikes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: I was watching Satan fall from heaven as lightning

contextId.information: "as little children." People who know that they are not wise and knowledgeable are willing to be taught, as children are willing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Jesus states the same truth as a simile. He speaks of people who are full of truth as if they are a lamp that shines brightly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: then your whole body will be like when a lamp shines its brightness on you

contextId.information: The Pharisees were like unmarked graves because they looked ceremonially clean, but they caused people around them to become unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: you are like unmarked graves that people walk over without knowing it

contextId.information: This compares the disciples being ready for Jesus to return to servants who are ready for their master to return. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: be like people looking for their master

contextId.information: Jesus compares the kingdom to a mustard seed. AT: "The kingdom of God is like a mustard seed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: It is like a mustard seed

contextId.information: A "mustard seed" is a very small seed. Jesus implies that they did not have even a small amount of faith. AT: "If you had faith that was even as small as a mustard seed" or "If only your faith was as big as a mustard seed, but it is not" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If you had faith as a mustard seed

contextId.information: The coming of the Son of Man will be clear and sudden, like the appearance of lightning. AT: "for as the lightning is visible to everyone when it appears and" or "for as the lightning appears suddenly" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: for as the lightning shines brightly

contextId.information: God requires people to accept his rule over them with trust and humility. AT: "whoever wants to enter God's kingdom must receive it with trust and humility like a child" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: whoever will not receive the kingdom of God like a child will definitely not enter it

contextId.information: Just as a trap closes on an animal when the animal does not expect it, that day will happen when people do not expect it. AT: "that day will happen when you are not expecting it, as when a trap closes suddenly on an animal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: then that day will close on you suddenly like a trap
